description: Moves students from intermediate to advanced oral proficiency through the use of German TV,
films and media sources. Focuses on higher-order functions such as paragraph-length narration,
presenting opinions, group discussions and individual presentations, as well as dramatic
readings, interviews, debates and conversations with native speakers. Taught in German.
Prerequisite: German 232 or equivalent. Counts toward the German major. Open to non-majors.
GE: FOL-G, ORC. Offered every Spring Semester.
